title: Cheat Sheet
description: Use this cheat sheet to brush up on your Linux commands and for all those Linux commands you can't quite remember!

userActivity.Value: /lib - "c" libraries used by programs and kernel
/usr - user programs and utilities (binaries, docs, libraries, include files, etc.)
/bin - OS essential binaries (ls, cp, mv, etc.)
/etc - system configuration files, includes startup scripts
/mnt - mount point for external file systems
/var - variable data (mail and printer spools, log files, lock files, etc.)

mv ./microsoft.list /etc/apt/sources.list.d/microsoft-prod.list
apt-get install gpg
curl -sSL https://packages.microsoft.com/keys/microsoft.asc | gpg --dearmor | sudo tee /etc/apt/trusted.gpg.d/microsoft.gpg > /dev/null
apt-get install apt-transport-https
apt-get update
apt-get install mdatp
